title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Inclusively is partnering with a pharmaceutical and biotechnology corporation to hire an Administrative Assistant, Strategy and Consulting. **Please note: this role is NOT an internal position with Inclusively but with the partner company.**
ABOUT INCLUSIVELY:Inclusively is a digital tech platform that connects candidates with disabilities, who may benefit from workplace accommodations, to inclusive employers. This includes all disabilities under the ADA, including mental health conditions (e.g. anxiety, depression, PTSD), chronic illnesses (e.g. diabetes, Long COVID), and neurodivergence (e.g. autism, ADHD). Applicants with one or more of these conditions are encouraged to apply; Inclusively does not require applicants to disclose their specific disability.
What You Will AchieveA career with Strategy and Consulting, Business Innovation is about being part of a team that helps set and execute strategy across the enterprise in support of our growth aspirations. 
The Administrative Professional will report to the Director of Business Operations & Consulting Services within Business Innovation at our company. 
The role will provide comprehensive support executing a full range of administrative duties. In this role, responsibilities include (but are not limited to) heavy calendar management, coordination of complex meetings including executive stakeholders, assembly of briefing materials, arranging travel, expense report preparation, and planning and organizing events (internal in-person trainings, project workshops, etc.). 
As a working professional, he/she will be expected to handle tasks independently, proactively, and discreetly. This position will also coordinate with other Administrative Professionals in Strategy and Consulting, as well as across the organization to support the work of the department.
It is your hard work and focus that will make our company ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.
How You Will Achieve ItCore responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Provide comprehensive day-to-day administrative support to 2 Vice Presidents.Proactively maintain complex calendar; anticipate conflicts and use diplomacy to resolve issues in advanceHandles full spectrum of travel arrangements (i.e. research/book flights, hotels and ground transportation; cross-site access, passport and visa documents) and provide itinerariesPrepare and submit expense reports for review; perform reconciliations in line with our company policyOrganize teleconferences, WebEx, videoconference and in-person meetings and ensure all technologies needed are available, operational, and all guests are registeredRequest and prepare briefing materials for meetings in advance, handling confidential information with discretionPartner with the Business Operations Lead to facilitate the logistics and planning of meetings and events for Strategy and Consulting (e.g. SC Town Halls, team events, External meetings, etc.)Manage and update distribution lists, organizational chart, key meetings documentsAssist the Business Operations Lead with the Strategy and Consulting Reward & Recognition ProgramProactively and independently organize and expedite workflow and initiate follow-up when necessary to ensure deadlines are metCollaborate with Administrative peers on department-wide initiatives and events as neededManage the onboarding and off-boarding of any Strategy and Consulting contractorsOpen and track all purchase orders and work with vendors to ensure invoices are paid in a timely manner; liaise with finance as neededAssist with administrative needs associated with recruiting and on-boarding new team membersFlexibility may be required to occasionally work later or longer hours to accommodate special events/assignments.
QualificationsMust-HaveHigh school degree required.3-5 years administrative experienceMust be professional, self-motivated, flexible, open to growth and challenges and a proven team playerAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced dynamic environment while demonstrating a resourceful, positive attitude and a superior work ethicExcellent attention to detail and highly organized and able to successfully handle simultaneous priorities, with speed and accuracyA strong sense of personal integrity; able to maintain confidentiality and handle highly sensitive information; demonstrate good judgment and decision-makingProfessional and articulate communication skills; able to seamlessly interact with experienced professionals.Ability to remain calm and professional under pressureDemonstrated resourcefulness, with ability to anticipate needs, prioritize responsibilities, anticipate and solve problems, and take initiativeCustomer service orientation, as S&C is an enabling function
Nice-to-HaveCollege degree preferredExperience supporting a senior leader preferred
Technical Skills Requirements:Excellent technical skills and comfort with new technologies that will enable simplicity and efficiency: PC proficient and expert at MS Office, including Word, Excel, PPT, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, teleconference/WebEx and videoconferencing solutions.
Hourly range for this role would be from $31.361to $52.27.
Other Job Details:Last Date to Apply for Job: 23 APRIL 2024Eligible for Employee Referral BonusNot eligible for Relocation Assistance
Work Location Assignment: FlexibleFlexible colleagues are assigned a company site within a commutable distance where they work about 2-3 days weekly to connect and innovate with their team face-to-face. However, they also benefit from being able to work offsite regularly when it makes business sense to do so.
The salary for this position ranges from $31.99 to $53.31 per hour. In addition, this position offers eligibility for overtime, weekend, holiday and other pay premiums depending on the work schedule and the Company’s policies. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with company Matching Contributions and an additional company Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Our compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided applies only to the United States - New York - New York City location.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.

title: Digital Product Owner II
description:
Inclusively is partnering with a financial services company to hire a Digital Product Owner II. **Please note: this role is NOT an internal position with Inclusively but with the partner company.**
ABOUT INCLUSIVELY:Inclusively is a digital tech platform that connects candidates with disabilities, who may benefit from workplace accommodations, to inclusive employers. This includes all disabilities under the ADA, including mental health conditions (e.g. anxiety, depression, PTSD), chronic illnesses (e.g. diabetes, Long COVID), and neurodivergence (e.g. autism, ADHD). Applicants with one or more of these conditions are encouraged to apply; Inclusively does not require applicants to disclose their specific disability.
The Finance Digital Products organization at our company is focused on enhancing business functions while interfacing with technology partners to create an unparalleled experience. Leveraging these critical insights, we implement technology solutions and develop our products in ways that enable our firm capabilities. As key members of the team, Digital Product Owners combine deep subject matter expertise, vision, strategy, systems thinking, and product management capabilities to produce highly integrated and effective digital solutions and tools.
What You'll Do…The Product Owner serves as the individual accountable for one or more systems, leading a multi-disciplinary and cross-divisional product team to deliver value to internal and external customers of the Firm.The role is accountable for the respective product's branch compensation experience which necessitates a systems thinking approach.This individual aligns strategy to execution through the development and maintenance of their product roadmap, outlining the body of work expected now, next, and into the future.This work includes the management of system plans and supporting artifacts encompassing resource needs, stakeholder solution requirements, dependencies, timelines, milestones, and success criteria as necessary to deliver on the promised business value.Success in this role requires depth and breadth of subject matter experts inside and outside the Branch Compensation product area, as well as a foundational understanding of Product Management and Agile, and the ability to expand these capabilities within the organization.Collaborate with leaders to attract, develop, and drive a team of high-performing associates, and will play a pivotal role in their ongoing personal and professional development.Drive the matrixed product team through influence as well as task assignment authority, mentoring, and coaching all team members to fulfill the product vision.Advise and align with adjacent product teams to ensure a consistent and cohesive progression of the product strategy.
What Experience You Need…Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, related field, or equivalent work experience.4+ years of experience in the Agile framework or 4+ years of experience in Product Ownership/ManagementStrong knowledge of financial services concepts, practices, and procedures, with emphasis on the ProductRobust knowledge of full-cycle software development within an Agile framework.
What Could Set You Apart...Experience using Jira, Aha! and other collaboration toolsStrong understanding of compensation philosophy and practicesUnderstanding of other HR functional areas
Candidates that live within in a commutable distance from our Tempe, AZ and St. Louis, MO home office locations are expected to work in the office three days per week, with a preference for Tuesday through Thursday.

title: Sales Analyst
description:
PowerStop stands out as the pioneering force within the automotive aftermarket brake sector. Being part of PowerStop’s team entails becoming a member of a company that is reshaping the industry’s landscape. Join us and become an integral part of a brand that is undergoing remarkable expansion, where you can confidently expect to have the opportunity to contribute significantly to our team’s success. We are continually in search of enthusiastic and achievement-driven individuals who possess the drive and enthusiasm to aid us in achieving our goals. Moreover, we highly value candidates who share a passion for automobiles and a willingness to grasp the industryThe Sales Analyst will be a key contributor to the company by supporting and partnering with the Commercial and related teams to profitability and grow the business. The role will also engage with sales, marketing, and operational leadership team on developing and maintaining rolling sales forecasting plans, weekly and monthly updates on revenue estimates/scenarios, as well as coordinate such plans for SIOP (Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning) process. Discuss monthly results, and recent trends, as well as assist in forward-looking actions related to forecasts to the management teams. 
The person in this role will also have strong financial and general business acumen and play a key role in developing and implementing the company's financial and strategic plans and formulating their financial plan, fiscal budget, and forecasts. This role offers a unique opportunity to learn about the organization and develop relationships with finance, sales & marketing, and other business leaders across the company
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Sales Responsibilitiesinternal, and external pricing levels, proactively flagging intra & inter-channel conflicts/opportunities, and customers whose pricing is abnormally high or low& communicate recurring customer opportunity reporting, including order confirmation rates, lost sales reports, missed opportunities, chargebacks, etc.; Work cross-functionally to minimize chargebacks and increase fill rateand assess customer contract terms, identifying recommendations to improve sales and/or profitabilityassess all Price Governance submissions for preliminary CCO buy-inand maintain templates for customer MBR/QBR/YBR; Populate content to facilitate meetingsand maintain customer, cohort, and channel scorecardsIn Stock Not Online (ISNO) SKUs on key accounts, and identify & distribute obsolete lists by CustomerCustomer Master list, including email contacts for corporate communicationsto manage & evolve with things such as the customer awards process and holiday gift process& Manage approvals for Warranty Returns and Stock Adjustmentsthe sales/operations/product teams with things like but not limited to, auditing customer catalogs, identifying assortment expansion opportunities by customer and cohort; identification, remediation, and tracking for “Biggest Losers” SKU’s; monthly POS data reportingas a key Finance Dept contact for projects involving Sales and Operations by providing data, reporting formats, and analytical/decision-making advice and support to managers at various levels.
Financial Responsibilitieswith the Operations leadership team on direct labor effectiveness, KPIs reporting, and analytics and help guide labor demand planningvariance analysis, budget development and forecasting, and monthly management presentation preparationareas of opportunity and process improvement in areas of responsibilitystatistical and operational data to draw a correlation between periodic sales and operational results, providing greater insight and decision-making abilities to senior managementproduce, and analyze key commercial/sales metrics (KPI's). Manage development of financial models; conduct benchmarking and process analysis across multiple business segmentsand suggest improvements of all current commercial/sales processes and systems and provide assistance to automate processes and implement;in various ad hoc financial analysis, financial systems and process improvements, and special projects.
Qualifications & Experience:Bachelor's Degree; Accounting, Finance, or Economics or related discipline or equivalent work experience, required.3+ years of related professional work experience, distribution and e-commerce experience preferred.Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:experience with exposure to complex internal reporting and analytical processes and exposure to executive leadership;to distill complex financial information to effectively communicate financial and accounting concepts to people with non-financial backgrounds;knowledge of financial forecasting and diagnosis, corporate finance, and information analysis;initiative, follow through, and ability to manage multiple projects with keen attention to detail and deadlines;ability to maintain confidentiality when working with sensitive and proprietary information;in Microsoft Office, financial software applications, highly proficient in Excel; SQL experience, Power BI experience preferred;in being able to work with different teams, particularly Sales and Marketing/Product Management, in addition to Finance, Operations, and other departments as requiredwith analyzing and presenting large volumes of complex dataabilities to assess the reasonableness of information collected/provided, identify trends, provide comments and recommendations Competencies:Networking: Demonstrates ability to work collaboratively to achieve company business plan and goals Teamwork: Team-oriented with the ability to develop a team and coach others, and earn the respect of other team members Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead and drive executionInterpersonal Communication: Possess exceptional interpersonal and communication skills needed to effectively share and engage internal stakeholders and clinical areas with the most relevant data. Strategic Planning: A strategic thinker regarding competitive strategy, business models, and financial management and the ability to connect the bigger picture to day to day operations of the organization Urgency & Motivation: High energy, self-motivated, and hands-on management style working with all levels of the organization to drive performance and continuous improvement using an analytic and metrics-based approach. Must contribute and thrive in a dynamic high-paced environment.
EEO Statement:All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or national origin

title: Electrical Engineer Commercial Construction
description:
Job Location:

Miami International Mall

Monthly travel to the Indianapolis HQ will be required.

Primary Purpose

This technical position is responsible for managing Electrical and Low Voltage engineering design of Simon retail and mixed-use commercial developments. The positions’ goal is to achieve cost effective technical solutions which enable corporate goals and objectives to be met.

Principal Responsibilities

 Management of Electrical Consultants: Provide technical oversight and direct project management associated with designs prepared by contracted engineering consultants. Jointly manage, with Simon’s Project Manager, the MEP consultant’s contract, and invoices. Jointly manage, with Simon’s Design Manager, the drawing production process to ensure accuracy and compliance with project schedule. Provide oversight to ensure compliance with Simon MEP Criteria and Best Engineering Practices. Review drawings, specifications, RFP’s, bid proposals, etc. and provide feedback as required. Simon Information Services and Low Voltage Management: Manage the integration of all the Low Voltage systems into the overall project design and construction process. Meet with Simon IS to review current design standards and then coordinate with preferred Simon Vendors and Design Consultants. Schedule and conduct Low Voltage (LV) Coordination Meetings with the Design Consultants and the Simon Preferred LV Vendors. Joint Management of Lighting Designers: In conjunction with the Design Manager and Project Manager, direct the contracted lighting consultants with respect to the development of interior and exterior lighting systems and controls. This shall include task, decorative, site and deck lighting as required. Provide feedback to the design team regarding light output, energy efficiency, durability, ease of maintenance plus, fixture cost. Construction Administration: Support Project Manager and contract MEP/FP consultant through construction observation, submittal evaluation, the review of tenant plans (in conjunction with Tenant Coordination) and interfacing with tenant’s engineers as appropriate. Monitor work for compliance with Simon MEP Criteria and Best Engineering Practices.

Secondary Responsibilities

 Answer technical questions for Property Management, Tenant Coordination, Risk Management and other departments. Review drawings, specifications, RFP’s, bid proposals, etc. and provide feedback as required. Interface regularly with Energy Services and Procurement for purposes of evaluating new products (i.e., light fixtures, meters, switchgear, etc.) and providing technical input whenever national contracts are bid. Provide review of vendor specific Electrical Vehicle charging stations across Simon’s portfolio. As requested, provide technical feedback and recommendations to the Head of Sustainability regarding opportunities for implementing sustainable initiatives.

Minimum Job Requirements

 Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities A working knowledge and understanding of retail development and the design process. Knowledge of multi-family and hospitality design a plus. The ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously with minimal direction. Highly developed organizational skills. Effective written and verbal communications skills. A general knowledge of Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing & Fire Protection (MEPFP) codes and design conventions. Required Experience and Education Bachelor of Science in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering. Minimum ten (10) years of engineering experience including, but not limited to: lighting, power, HVAC power, controls, fire alarm, communication, security systems and energy management systems. Professional Registration (PE) Preferred

title: Brand Ambassador
description:
If you are looking for something more than just an entry-level position you have come to the right place! At Higher Ground Events we are looking for energetic and hard-working Brand Ambassadors to balance our team of highly talented marketing professionals.
Skills & Experience:· Excellent people/communicating skills (Bilingual skills are a plus)· Minimum of a High school diploma or GED.· Prior experience working with the public is preferable but not necessary!· Must be goal-oriented and a driving team ambition.· Experience working towards team goals – scholastic or vocational.· Must be highly organized and efficient.· Values of honesty and integrity are MUST.· Must be able to learn in a fast paced environment in order to demonstrate clients’ products.· Basic marketing and IT knowledge is a definite plus!· Must have an outgoing and friendly manner at all times.
Brand Ambassador Responsibilities:· Communication with clients and customers on a daily basis.· Learn and apply critical foundations of marketing and leadership in the office and field assignments.· Attain brand knowledge to be able to answer all questions regarding the benefits of a client’s products to customers.· Meet with customers at live events to showcase client products.· Organize, track and record daily sales.· Work with a marketing team to build brand and customer base for clients.· Travel to marketing events as needed.· Attend scheduled team and company meetings.· Must be able to travel to numerous locations.
Benefits of Working with Higher Ground Events :· Advance at your own pace and the only limit to your earning potential is YOU!· Opportunity for career and personal growth.· Travel to bring customers’ products to new audiences all the time.· Amazing compensation for marketing sales.· Upward growth with the company – we always promote from within!· Become a team leader through drive and motivation in record time.· Attend awards ceremonies - you could be next year’s top performer!· Networking prospects on a daily basis.· Learn marketing and business skills from award-winning marketing professionals from all around the world.
About Higher Ground Events:
Thriving as a liaison between exclusive clientele and consumers, Higher Ground Events is creating experiences to cultivate lifelong customers and brand loyalty for clients. Springing into the Georgia scene with a massive client portfolio and a team with years of experience, Higher Ground is breaking the boundaries of the digital age by bringing customers closer to brands than ever before. 
We are currently seeking a Brand Ambassador with a desire to grow alongside a group of like-minded entrepreneurs.If you are looking for a career with a great amount of potential growth, click the Apply button to submit your resume. We look forward to hearing from you today!

title: Revenue Cycle Auditor
description:
Are you a meticulous and experienced Revenue Cycle Auditor looking to join a dynamic team? LaSalle Network has partnered with a premiere healthcare services company as they look to expand their team. As a Revenue Cycle Auditor, you will be responsible for investigations received from the revenue cycle department and working a yearly audit plan.
 
 Revenue Cycle Auditor Responsibilities:Conducts comprehensive retrospective and/or prospective coding/billing/documentation audits for multi-specialties within the medical group and/or facility departments, as assignedAnalyzes source documents (including but not limited to, progress notes, operative reports, pathology reports, etc.) and associated billing documentation (such as encounter forms, EOBs, Epic billing data and related documents) for coding and billing accuracy Audits ICD-10-CM, CPT/HCPCS or ICD-10-PCS codes for appropriateness compared to medical record documentation by applying appropriate corporate policy, state/federal regulation, coding rules, commercial payer guidelines, and/or Medicare/Medicaid guidelines (e.g. NCDs, LCDs, Medicare Manuals, and DRG/APC/RBRVS/other relevant Prospective Payment System billing rules)Conducts internal Compliance investigations in response to external concerns. These investigations can involve high-risk scenarios that require immediate and extensive review while maintaining a strict level of confidentialityIdentifies trends or patterns of questionable coding and billing practices for the System and reports issues to Manager. Communicates incidental findings identified in audits for potential future investigationDocuments relevant findings for all audits and investigations conducted, including pertinent details from interviews, claim audits, control assessment, root cause analysis and corrective action plansCalculates reimbursement impact and statistical error rates based on findings in audits and investigations that may later result in larger overpayment calculations. Overpayment calculations may sometimes require data mining and testing skills to ensure report accuracy and using extrapolation methodologiesFacilitates communication of audit and investigational activities between internal/external customersKeeps current on topics related to coding, billing, and documentation requirements, including, but not limited to ICD-10-CM/PCS and CPT/HCPCS annual code changes and Medicare regulatory
 Revenue Cycle Auditor Requirements:Experience with analyzing and/or auditing Revenue Cycle functions; including, but not limited to, ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS coding accuracy, Medicare policy requirements and any other operational workflows affecting billing accuracy for hospital or physician claimsSkilled at medical coding and related research and analysis with the ability to stay up to date on regulatory and coding changes and applying those rule changes into audit and investigation projectsMust have the ability to interpret a variety of clinical documents and information, CMS policies and procedures, third party payer guidelines and government regulations and effectively communicate technical coding information to a variety of non-coder staff
 If you are interested in this exciting Revenue Cycle Auditor opportunity and feel you meet these qualifications, please apply today!
 
 Thank you,
 
 Laura Peterson
 Associate Unit Manager - Healthcare Revenue Cycle
 LaSalle Network LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v. LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.

title: Sales Engineer - Automotive Parts Manufacturing (34410)
description:

title: Category Manager - Non- Alcoholic Beverages
description:
With more than 13,000 stores in the U.S. and 84,000 stores globally, it is no wonder 7-Eleven, Inc. has been named an iconic brand. In addition to 7-Eleven stores, 7-Eleven, Inc. also operates and franchises Speedway, Stripes, Laredo Taco Company and Raise the Roost locations.

Since inventing the convenience industry in 1927, 7-Eleven has built a rich 96-year history filled with beloved products like Slurpee, Big Gulp and Big Bite, and fan-favorite holidays like Slurpee Day and Bring Your Own Cup Day.

Now, 7-Eleven is on a mission to contemporize the brand and redefine convenience – and we need your help.

▶ About This Opportunity

Manage the strategic development and planning for assigned category, as a subset of a larger group of categories led by the Senior Category Manager. Ensure category sales plans are consistent with the overall Merchandising strategy. Promote and verify execution of category strategy at the store and ensure that the category fits into the total store perspective.

Duties And Responsibilities

Develop, manage and communicate sales plans for delegated categories and support additional categories as requested to support Senior CM in development of overall category sales plans.Complete entry for national sales planning tool, including de-averaged costs/retail, and new/expanded items/offers.Ensure marketing and POP are developed for all categories as determined by the Senior CM for the monthly sales plan; proof monthly solicitation for accuracy, make recommendations as necessary to support development of regional POP item forecasts.Facilitate vendor meetings and negotiate for delegated categories. Support Product Director and Senior Category Manager on day-to-day activities that include Strategic Pricing team as well as supporting Senior Category Manager in the preparation for and engagement in vendor meetings related to product assortment architecture and cost of goods negotiations.Develop and execute strategic merchandising initiatives such as roles and intents of categories, segmentation and vendor and product specific strategies. Vendor or Supplier Relationships / Supply Chain ManagementOwn and manage vendor relationships for assigned small categories as a primary contact and assist Senior CM in vendor relationships for key national relationships. Collaborate with Logistics, Senior Category Manager to ensure stable supply within the demand chain including close collaboration with Logistics team/partners. Ensure products are delivering on quality/value needs of customers. Negotiate delegated category offers, costs, bill-backs, allowances, terms, co-op media and other related opportunities; coordinate / communicate with Senior Category Manager. Ensure proper information provided for suppliers including product costs, bill-back, allowances, discounts, LDUÆs, routing information, new item set up details and new vendor set up details. Provide forecasting information including initial committed inventories, historic sales, store turns, seasonality, past order frequency and cannibalization for all delegated categories and provide support for categories at request of the Senior CM in conjunction with Merchandiser and Category Specialist. Assortment / Display management (including POP / Customer messaging)Lead national schematics efforts on behalf of the Senior CM. Coordinate with Merchandiser to ensure regional sets are developed and in line with the national strategy. Review strategy and decisions with the Senior CM before implementation. Track all key sales metrics (sales/group/unit/margin) for delegated categories and additional categories as requested. Analyze and share insights with Senior Category Manager, Product Director, Zone Leader and other Operations leadership to driving improved results and enhance understanding of the business.Evaluate SSI and NRIs for further testing or expansion to ensure the optimal recommended assortment. Accountable for optimizing Gross Profit dollars within delegated category role and overall category growth. Conduct ongoing financial analysis of national sets by evaluating product SKU productivity.Develop and oversee in-store testing of potential new products, concepts and promotional activity within delegated categories and assist for other categories as requested. Optimize display management opportunities within assigned category and assigned zones. Support testing activity including preparation/delivering communication materials, tracking of results/feedback to Test areas/stores, verification in stores/Franchise feedbackAssist with integration of roles and intents and segmentation into assortment decisions at the national and regional level. Work with vendors to introduce/expand new/existing items based on store and customer segments while retracting items in underperforming segments to optimize overall assortment.Coordinate SEE vendor sponsorships, samplings, and other events on a national and regional level for categories supported. Rework and troubleshoot outputs (decisions on proposed items, item setup, etc) and handing requests from accounting. Conduit for communicationProvide point-of-view to Operational leadership based on CSA/marketplace understanding; be advocate for customer across the category engage Operations to support.Assist Senior CM in communicate requirements, volume changes/sales plan, other key sales plan information to Division Logistics Manager/Logistics team and coordinate readiness for delivery.Assist the Senior CM in communicating integrated sales plans (national/zone) and ensure comprehensive delivery of necessary facts/data/SOP.Support Merchandiser in the coaching and development of the Operations team regarding best merchandising practices for the category at store level.Education: Bachelors/4 Yr DegreeExperience: 2-5 yrs, . Strong analytical skills. Effective communication. Negotiating experience.Understanding of financial methodology to determine costs and to develop annual business plan.

title: Grower - Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) Greenhouse
description:
Relocation assistance is available
**Solid experience in growing leafy greens/vegetables for commercial production in large-scale high-tech greenhouses using climate control software is required**
Job Summary:The Grower facilitates all aspects of the Company’s production activities.
Duties/Responsibilities:The below duties are a summary. The full job descriptions can be found on our career page.To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The duties listed below are representative of the essential functions, qualifications, physical demands, and the work environment encountered in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with any other duties as assigned:
Ensure Exceptional Plant Health: Utilizing their experience and the resources available to them, the Grower will be responsible for the overall health of the plantsEnsure Exceptional Product Quality: Responsible for growing products which meet or exceed quality standards.Food Safety Compliance: Responsible for ensuring that product grown at the facility comply with company food safety standards.Recording, organizing and communicating Growing Systems Data: Responsible the aggregation of production data from the operation and to quickly and efficiently communicate any issues that might affect production.Determine Wholistic Training Program Requirements: Responsible for developing and conducting employee training at facility.
Grower Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree in Horticulture, Agriculture, Biology, Plant Science, CEA, or another Growing related degree from a four-year college or university plus at least 5 years of experience;Or Associate’s degree in one of the aforementioned degrees, plus 7 years of growing experience;Or at least 10 years of experience without a college degree;Experience listed in the requirements above must be in greenhouse plant growing with at least one year of experience in High Tech CEA Greenhouses using Priva, Hoogendorn, Hortimax or another climate management system;Experience growing leafy greens highly preferred. 
Senior Grower Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or University in Horticulture, Agriculture, Biology, Plant Science, CEA, or another Growing related degree; Master’s degree preferred.Management skills.+10 years of growing and high-tech greenhouse operations.5 years of experience in management positions.Experienced in strategic planning, budgeting, and resource allocation for large-scale, commercial vegetable and/or leafy green production.Experienced in leading growing production in large-scale commercial CEA greenhouses, including hydroponic and vertical production, preferably in leafy green and lettuces.Experienced in Moving Gutter System (Green Automation, Hortiplan, FGM system, etc.).Experienced in managing nutrients, lights, temperature control, airflow, irrigation design, etc.Experienced in Priva, Hoogendorn and/or Hortimax climate management systems.Experienced in extreme climate conditions (hot and humid).Knowledge of facilities maintenance and project management.Experienced in the development and design of CEA Greenhouse electrical, irrigation, heating, cooling, and structure. 
Pay Ranges, depending on education and experienceAssistant Grower - up to $60,000Junior Grower - up to $80,000Grower - up to $100,000Senior Grower - up to $120,000
ABOUT LOCAL BOUNTILocal Bounti is a leading controlled environment agriculture (CEA) company. Our mission is to bring our farm to your kitchen and deliver the freshest, locally-grown produce in the fewest food miles possible.
By growing local we help eliminate food waste and provide fresh, high-quality produce. Our sustainable greenhouse technology delivers ideal growing conditions for each of our crops, resulting in 90% less water consumption and 95% less land use than conventional agriculture, no need for herbicides or pesticides, and the lowest carbon footprint in the industry.
Our mission is rooted in sustainability and in turn human welfare.
We are committed to growing and cultivating our employees' well-being so that they feel they are in a career environment that enables them to thrive personally and professionally. We strive to ensure that our employees feel empowered, valued, and respected. We want our employees to be passionate about their work because this shared passion for what we do is the lifeblood of our company.
We provide an educational and safe work environment and are dedicated to helping our employees grow within the company. We are proud to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package to employees working over 30 hours a week.

title: Staff Geotechnical Engineer
description:
We are currently accepting applications for immediate opening for a full time, entry level, Staff Geotechnical Engineer to be based at our Gray, Maine office. The S. W. Cole Engineering team is an established employee owned firm with a history of over 40 years of success and stable growth serving clients throughout New England. 
This position involves coordinating, monitoring, and observing field exploration activities; observing, monitoring and collecting geotechnical data during construction phase activities at project sites; performing geotechnical analyses and calculations; writing reports, emails, proposals and other correspondence; collecting project data, information, and gathering documents; communicating effectively and consistently with teammates, design professionals and contractors. Other responsibilities include accurately tracking time spent on projects, safe operation and handling of company testing equipment and vehicles in accordance with company policies/safety policies, interacting with staff, general public, client representatives, officials, and contractors. The Geotechnical Engineer will begin to cultivate relationships and occasionally attend professional development and business and industry events. Will also occasionally assist our construction materials testing department, and have some involvement in trade organizations. 
Job Requirements
B.S. Civil Engineering required by June 2024, with emphasis in Geotechnical Engineering, or Engineering Geology preferred.Hold, or obtain FE/EIT within 6 months after hire, required.Valid driver’s license, active auto insurance, and reliable transportation.Experience with and knowledge of computer software including Microsoft Office, SharePoint, MathCAD, geotechnical analysis programs, and able to learn new programs.Understand and apply developed math skills.Broad knowledge of civil engineering principles and practices.Ability to communicate effectively in both verbal and written form.Ability to make decisions and meet deadlines.Regularly spend long hours sitting/standing and in office and field environments which includes moving (carrying, pushing, lifting) soil, rock and construction material samples up to 60 pounds.Skilled in collecting, analyzing, and organizing complex data, compiling reports, and maintaining records of time and supplies.Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer. We are not able to sponsor employment Visas at this time.
To be considered for this position please fill out the application, and upload a resume with cover letter. The cover letter should demonstrate your writing skills and summarize how your experience and qualifications make you a good candidate for this position. S.W.COLE has Great Benefits !!
Our team members are offered a benefits package that, depending on eligibility, includes: 
Medical, dental and vision insurance  Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer match 8 paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) accrued each week Paid short and long term disability and basic life insurance401k with employer match and profit sharing Voluntary life insuranceCritical Illness and Accident protection plans Mobile phone stipend Tuition reimbursement Safety toe shoe program and an allowance to use at our company clothing store.  Paid identity theft protection
We have three options for traveling between our office and job sites for field based team members – 1) Use your own suitable vehicle and we compensate you for your mileage. 2) Use one of our company trucks. 3) Join our Company Vehicle Program, which includes an allotment for personal use. 
S. W. Cole Engineering, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

title: Community Association Manager (FTWTX2024-6957)
description:
We are a company that understands and appreciates your professionalism and hard work. We are a company that provides support with a Manager Success Group, continuous training, administrative support, etc. to all team members. RealManage is committed to do everything possible to ensure your long-term career success. With RealManage, you are not just an employee, you are family.

 Company Overview: 

RealManage / Vision Communities Management Texas is a national Inc. 5000 firm with clients and operations in 24 states coast to coast that delivers services to homeowners’ associations (HOAs), condominium associations, cooperatives, luxury high-rises, municipal utility districts, and master-planned communities. RealManage also serves nationally recognized developer/builder clients.

As one of the largest (#3 out of 5,000+ firms) and fastest-growing companies in the community management industry, RealManage offers exceptional solutions provided at competitive prices with the best people, best practices, and best technology of cloud-based and mobile apps. The RealManage / Vision Communities Management Texas mission is to provide comprehensive and innovative solutions; exceed the expectations of our customers; provide visibility and transparency in all that we do for our clients who place their trust in us; measure our performance and improve at the fastest rate possible; create a work environment that encourages professionalism, growth, and diversity; and grow a financially strong organization which will enable us to provide industry leading innovations apart from our competition.

RealManage / Vision Communities Management Texas is a values-based company with the following values as our guiding principles:

 Integrity: we always do the right thing.  Respect: for our customers, employees and company; mutual respect is the cornerstone for every RealManage relationship.  Selflessness: more than teamwork; we are part of something special and much larger than any of us.  Personal Relationships: we are a professional services company; people do business with people they like.  Always Improving: never satisfied, always learning and always growing; one is either getting worse or getting better...never staying the same. At RealManage /Vision Communities Management Texas , we are always getting better. 

Responsibilities

 Job Responsibilities:

 Portfolio Community Association Manager?: 

Are you looking to find a work place you can call home? Do you strive to grow in a fast-paced industry with a company dedicated to helping you embrace your profession? Vision Communities Management, VCM, Inc., is a fast-growing community association management firm with a commitment to investing in our associates. With leadership who still believe that a hands-on approach ensures that our communities receive the best expertise and quality in the business. Do you believe in creating a community’s vision through customer service, expertise and accountability? Then come join your vision with ours.

Position Summary:

We are looking for an individual who is motivated to advance, and would like to maintain long-term employment with our company. This position oversees a small portfolio of associations while offering support to our team. Responsibilities will include working with association managers and leadership to help create each community’s vision. A successful candidate must have a commitment to exceptional customer service and quality control. Great written and oral communications skills is required. Also required are great organizational skills and the ability to work productively in a fast-paced environment. This individual should be able to juggle multiple concurrent projects at any given time. Previous HOA experience is preferred. .

Position Responsibilities - Management:

 Demonstrate and promote the mission, values and culture of VCM / RealManage.  Exhibit exceptional customer service with homeowners and Boards – adhering to our 24-hour response time Typically will manage the day-to-day for a portfolio of 8-12 communities Plan, coordinate, and run Board and Annual Meetings Maintain community meeting calendar Coordinate community-wide communications, eblast, and mailings Complete inspection drives & enforce community restrictions Attend occasional night meetings and community events if requested by the Board Coordination with vendors to ensure contract fulfillment, e.g., landscape, masonry, fence, pool maintenance, etc.  Maintain positive relationship with homeowners with timely responses and proactive communication Assist other Community Association Managers as required

Plus other work related tasks as needed

 To be the very best at this position, we look for the following qualities. 

 Excellent interpersonal skills . You will have to manage a wide range of personalities with a wide range of opinions, both over the phone and in person. You should be a friendly, outgoing person who can represent the company well in all situations.  Excellent writing skills . Our customers require thoughtful, concise, timely responses to their concerns. Much of this communication occurs over e-mail.  Excellent technology skills. Most of your day will be spent managing data utilizing our proprietary software. You should be comfortable using and learning technology software which allows you to access Owner / Residential portals, Management / Board portals, Closing portals, Attorney Portals, and Vendor portals all from one landing page.  Flexibility and humility . We approach our business with the mentality the we are here to serve. That means that you need to be willing and able to do what is necessary to please your clients, whatever that may be. You should be comfortable and willing to pitch in and do whatever needs to be done.  Excellent organizational skills. You will be working with hundreds of owners divided among a portfolio of properties. We have established excellent, efficient systems to facilitate this work, but you need to have strong organizational skills and be attentive to detail to use the systems effectively.  The ability to work independently. Because this is a growing business, you need to be comfortable working alone or independently at times. We will provide training and set goals, provide the technology and systems for you to achieve those goals. You will be empowered to make decisions and will be held accountable for your decisions. 

Qualifications

 Qualifications: 

 Associate or higher degree highly preferred.  Minimum of one (1) year managing Homeowner Associations (HOAs) required.  CAI designation(s) strongly preferred.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers.  Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service.  Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices. 

 Pay and Benefits: 

$55,000 to $65,000, depending on education and experience.

 Benefits include: 

 Medical Insurance  Dental Insurance  Vision Insurance  Life and Disability Insurance  HSA (Required High Deductible Medical Plan to be eligible)  FSA  Education Reimbursement  401K matching  Employee Assistance Program (EAP)  9 paid Holidays

title: Mechanic Apprentice
description:
As a global marketing experience company, Quad’s goal is to help our clients win every day. We use our data-driven integrated marketing and manufacturing platform to streamline solutions for our clients, reduce friction and enhance their marketing spend effectiveness. We’ve built a rich legacy by believing in our people, allowing them to act like owners and to take charge of their own success. Whether an operator, sales rep, a graphic artist or a clinician, we’re all driven to perform at our best— for ourselves and our clients. At our core, we’re a company that believes we can always create a better way.

Quad is seeking Industrial Mechanic Apprentices for our Sussex, Hartford, Pewaukee and Lomira, Wisconsin plant locations.

This is a 4-year, State of Wisconsin Registered Apprenticeship program that combines on-the-job training with classroom instruction at an approved technical college.

While in the plant, Quads mechanic apprentice will be responsible for the following:

Assisting with the installation, servicing and troubleshooting of production and automated support equipment.Completing rotations through various maintenance departments; Quad Metal Works, Predictive, Mechanical Departments in Building, Press and Finishing. 

Upon successful completion of the program, the position will be responsible for performing a wide variety of installation and repair work on mechanical systems.

Required Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:

High school diploma or equivalent is required, as select candidates will be required to complete a standard admissions assessment at an approved technical college. Strong verbal and written comprehension, with the ability to thrive in a team environment and work well under supervision. The ability to work responsibly in a variety of environments, including at heights up to 50 feet.

Preferred Qualifications

Mechanical aptitude, strong math skills and basic computer skills, are highly desirable. Experience or exposure in an advanced manufacturing environment or recent, skilled trade related classes is preferred but, not required. Apprentices may be required to travel locally in order to complete program requirements, therefore, the ability to travel between our plants is essential. 

We offer excellent benefits to eligible employees, including 401(k), holidays, vacations and more.

Quad is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We are committed to creating a place of belonging — a space where employees do not need to sacrifice who they are to exist and grow in our workplace. title: Video Teller
description:
DescriptionThis position will be responsible for greeting customers virtually (hybrid flexible but can change with needs of the company) and working with Interactive Teller Machines (ITM) housed in our Rockville HQ location and may also be required to float to branches as needed. Extended Friday evening hours and Saturday work days are required for this position.
We are looking for more than just an employee, we are looking for a true team member dedicated to enhancing the member experience! Come join the credit union movement and Discover Banking With Heart at NIHFCU!
At NIHFCU, one of our core values is investing in our employees, which is why we offer perks like these:
• Benefit Package for all Full time employees includes health, dental, vision, Life insurance benefits• 401(K) and profit sharing• Tuition Reimbursement• Career Advancement and development• Credit Union Membership with discounted services and products

GENERAL SUMMARYResponsible for: Under general supervision, but following established policies and procedures performs a broad range of activities to include excellent service to the Members, Referring and Cross-selling Credit Union services, accurately balancing each day's transactions, verifies cash and general ledger totals. Provide a variety of Member service functions such as processing savings accounts, checking accounts, loan transactions and cashing checks. Assists with balancing the branch's daily activities and totals.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Member Service:• Ability to demonstrate quality member service and full range of financial transactions through Interactive technology machines (ITM) and guide members through ITM process and promote the benefits of new technology..• Consistently adhere to Operational Procedures, Controls, and Services Levels consistent with NIHFCU standards.• Represents the Credit Union to the Members in a courteous and professional manner and provide prompt, efficient, and accurate service in the processing of transactions.• Attend required training and take initiative to maintain and develop needed knowledge and skills required to maintain effective performance.• Remains calm during challenging member interactions and escalate such situations as appropriate.• Complete required Compliance and assigned online training courses within specified periods.• Demonstrates a sound knowledge of computer software as it relates to job functions and/or necessary use. Ability to function with the interactive technology of an ITM. Is proficient with the use of standard office equipment including but not limited to PC, fax, copier, telephone, etc.• The ability to be bonded.
Sales, Service and Referrals:• Ability to explain various benefits and features of Credit Union products and services with the intent to refer and cross-sell.• Meet established Sales, Service and Referral Goals and other initiatives as assigned.• As Assigned, participate in Orientations, outside Marketing Activities and Events.
Operational Effectiveness & Transaction Processing• Accurately process monetary transactions, etc. upon verification of identification, signatures and Member account status and accurately enter transactions into the Credit Union records via the on-line teller terminal.• Review negotiable items with attention to detail to ensure negotiability.• Ability to accurately operate and balance a Teller Drawer within specified times.• Completes high quality work, which is free of errors, thorough, neat and with good attention to detail.• Achieve Productivity Goals (transactions per hour) per month.• Alert to Counterfeit Items, Red Flags (Identity Theft Prevention), Forgery (Checks, Money Orders, Travelers Cheques, etc.)• Assists with balancing and auditing branch functions to include ATM, CDM/TCD and negotiable items.
Accountabilities:• Demonstrate a professional image when representing NIHFCU (grooming, clothing, tone of voice, mannerism, etc.).• Maintain a dependable record of attendance and timeliness.• Thorough knowledge and understanding of all equipment functions/operations and applicable software in the branch.• Ensure that work practices comply with established NIHFCU policy, procedure, and standards.• Maintain confidentiality and security of all Member personal and financial information. Access Member or Employee personal and financial information only as required by the job.• Cover/Float to other branches and/or work extended hours to include Saturdays as determined by Management• Perform other related work as assigned and initiative using available resources to achieve established goals.• May be transferred to other Branches and Branch Departments as assigned by Management.• Report to the position Supervisor, Risk Management, the VP of Human Resources or to the complaint vendor any actual or suspected fraud or financial dishonesty or wrongdoing involving Member transactions, Employees, or NIHFCU.
Floating: May be transferred to other Branches and Branch Departments as assigned by Management. All employees are required to float as assigned and travel to other branches on a regular basis. Not all branch locations are accessible by Metro or Shuttle. In such cases, the Employee assigned as the first point of contact to covering one such branch should be in a position to cover the branch at short notices within a reasonable timeframe. Reliable transportation to cover branches is solely the responsibly of the employee.
RequirementsEDUCATION & EXPERIENCEHigh school diploma or equivalent (GED), with minimum 12-months Teller or retail cash handling experience. Ability to sell products and services and make referrals.Knowledge of Credit Union principles and practices preferred.This position requires on camera presence.Excellent verbal communication skills.REQUIRED COMPLIANCE COURSESEnsure that work results and processes comply with relevant laws and with established NIHFCU policies, procedures, and practices, including, but not limited to, the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA).Attend all required training or complete and pass all online required training courses as applicable.
NIHFCU is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against employees or applicants based on race, color, religion, sex/gender, national origin, disability, age, or any other category protected by law.

title: Piping Systems Engineer
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARYEngineers are responsible for the review of project specifications and preparation of drawings/schematics to be used in construction of various mechanical piping systems utilizing but not limited to Viega press systems. Engineers will handle all aspects of the design process, which can include analyzing the building, performing design calculations, choosing the appropriate piping systems for installation, materials, and labor estimates. Modeling of piping systems for construction or prefabrication as required.
 JOB DESCRIPTION DETAILSReviews project submissions for completenessEstablish communication with customer(s) to facilitate collaboration throughout entirety of projectReviews project specifications to determine technical concerns, requirements and/or feasibility of projectProject ownership from beginning to endModels piping system including pipe sizing and material as applicablePerform system calculations including volumes, flow rates, pressures, load calculations, etc.Optimize existing piping designs as applicable to improve performance, installation, or total cost of ownershipProvides Bill of Materials for piping systemDevelops labor comparisons for revised piping system designProvides submittal packages and specifications unique to projectOrganizes and maintains all project revisions including models, BOM, calculations, etc.Specifies equipment for piping systems based on customer needs and local requirementsWorks closely with contractor, engineer, Sales colleagues to manage project flow
OtherAttends meetings as required and/or assignedPerforms other duties as required and/or assignedComplies with the safety rules and guidelinesAssist colleagues with piping design reviewsOccasional travel will be required
Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesKnowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.Knowledge of general engineering practices and their applications.Strong knowledge of various piping systems and components (gas, domestic water, hydronic, air, etc.)Knowledge of computer software such as Microsoft Office, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.Excellent analytical and time management skillsAbility to analyze and make recommendations for workable solutions for a building’s piping needsAbility to communicate both verbally and in writing with internal and external customersAbility to work independently and in a team environmentAbility to perform with superior service, reflecting a positive company image while sustaining a positive attitude with those you interact with; always going above and beyond to help others out, regardless of their position or department.Understanding of construction processExperience with CAD programs at some level (2D, 3D, etc.) specifically Revit preferred.Ability to adhere to the highest standards of quality while continually performing at the highest possible level. 
Education, Certification/License & Work ExperienceBS in Engineering OR Plumbing/Contractor LicenseAND2 -5 years of related design experienceOR10 years related industry experienceEquivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered.

title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) Strategist
description:
Job Summary:
The Enterprise Marketing Technology Data Collection and Platforms Team is dedicated to capturing data from interactions on various CVS Health digital assets and making that data available throughout the organization to update customer profiles, inform optimization opportunities, and activate responsive touchpoints for the customer. Leveraging cutting edge technology and analytics, as an Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Strategist you will be on the forefront of maintaining and curating our most precious asset (the data!) through leading the continued development of our event tracking process, advising on strategy related to implementation and platform configuration based on analytics/reporting goals and training yourself and other developers on leading tools for measuring customer interactions. 
Key Responsibilities:- The Enterprise Marketing Technology Data Collection and Platforms Team plays an integral part in establishing an enterprise data strategy that will enable all other teams to leverage data as part of their work: informing marketing analytics and performance analytics functions, driving ongoing customer journey analytics and optimization, and leveraged in models to drive improved ability to meet members’ needs.-Act as internal consultant to stakeholders – working to define and understand their requirements and challenges, and forming data-driven approaches to produce strategic recommendations for implementation and adoption of CJA-Define and document CJA standards, best practices, and data collection processes-Partner with internal Data Collection and Platform team members to advise the best usage of the CJA technology for their business unit- Support ability the ability to report on Product OKRs or KPIs/Data Science objectives by proper instrumentation of tools- Partner with the tag management team to ensure interaction data is tracked by our web analytics and cx measurement tools, as well as deployment of technology to optimize all aspects of a customer’s experience (including marketing, merchandising, and optimization tools)- Troubleshoot platform issues as they arise within teams utilizing the technology, investigating technical details and data irregularities to help resolve- When possible support backend Data Engineering projects and goals where data quality, availability, validity, and governance are concerned- Guide and support title: Transportation Supervisor
description:
Summary
The Fleet Transportation Supervisor will provide leadership and guidance to Perdue Transportation's Private Fleet Associates in Lewiston, NC including Professional Drivers. The Transportation Supervisor is responsible for the management and administration of operations for Perdue Foods and Agri-Business while reporting to the Transportation Manager. This position is responsible for managing all phases and functions of Perdue Transportation Operations including both operations and administration in support of the timely delivery of dressed poultry products for the Transportation Department. Day shift schedule. Perdue Transportation operates 24/7, this position requires evening and weekend accessibility via phone.
Principal and Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Manage local safety systems for driver safety to ensure drivers are meeting or above goal – LYTX, TRUCE, etc. Manage local compliance with DOT / FMCSA standards with Driver Physicals, Driver License Renewal, Log Violations, Uncertified Drive Time, Random and Post Accident Drug ScreensComplete audits on driver fleet managing Pre-Trip / Post-Trip Inspection. Daily / Weekly equipment inspections on equipment. Complete daily trailer inventory on what is on the yard and validate in YMSComplete Ride a Long compliance – Weekly / Monthly – with new and current drivers to build relationships and provide coaching feedback on driver habits / safety concernsReview daily KPIs on fleet efficiency – Backhauls, Loads Per Driver, Empty Miles, Down Time, OTDManage local fleet Accident guidance – Provide a thorough investigation for the weekly Incident Review Board – Provide timely feedback in person to driver on corrective counseling – No less than 7 days old. Complete new hire interviews in person and establish a Fleet Retention plan with current challenges and goals on how to retain new / current driversReview and audit daily driver efficiency with OTD, Paperwork, and all daily expectations that the driver should be meeting. Provide constructive feedback with drivers in person and follow SOP on driver accountabilities Any other duties that may be assigned by Supervisor
Minimum Education
High School GraduatePreferred: Associates Degree
Experience Requirements
Qualified candidates must have excellent organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills; general knowledge of FMCSA DOT guidelines, and detailed geographical knowledge of the Eastern U.S
Experience Preferred
 3-5 years of transportation, distribution or logistics experience; strong interpersonal, communication and project management skills. Prior supervisor/management experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in a related field  Environmental Factors and Physical Requirements
Flexible work schedules (both days and hours) to handle weather, holidays or other service disruptions.24 hours, 7 days a week on-call basis for matters involving customer service or safety of drivers.Ability to travel to and from facility locations.Position is mostly sedentary but may require occasional moving to other offices or buildings.Exposed to office equipment, outside weather conditions, shop environmentPerdue Farms, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. title: System Director Women’s and Children’s Services
description:
Description

POSITION SUMMARY:

To be fully engaged in providing Product Excellence, Delight, Access, Ease and Convenience, and Customer Cost by providing system oversite of the planning, developing, leading and evaluating of clinical and support services for Women’s and Children’s Services across the hospital division.

Primary Accountabilities

Ease and Convenience: 

 Associate supports engagement through adherence to the I-CARE commitments. Acts under the direction of the VP of Nursing and as such, keeps him/her informed on the progress and status of objectives and action plans The System Director is accountable for maintaining harmonious interactions between department team members and their customers, including patients, family members, visitors, physicians, clergy, other system employees, and the general public Maintains a positive, open and effective relationship with the Medical Staffs, Hospital Management Teams and all levels of the associates through open communication, utilizing effective written and verbal skills. Assists the VP of Nursing in determining priorities as necessary to meet the changing demands of the Health System through effective planning, implementation and evaluation of Women’s and Children’s goals and objectives. The System Director is accountable for maintaining technical expertise and for development of leadership skills through ongoing education. Serves as liaison between system/hospital/clinic administration, physicians, departments, and staff to ensure cost-effective utilization of services and processes. Disseminates best practice information obtained from across Health First, and from outside system resources. The System Director will lead in a way to promote strategic thinking, to drive problem solving, and standardization of a care model for the service line by empowering a healthy workplace consistent with established standards. The System Director will promote empowerment of team members through supporting them to assume responsibility and accountability within their scope of practice.


Product Excellence

 Maintains an environment conducive to optimum safety for patients, visitors, and staff Ensures compliance with all patient safety goals Participates in the administration of Patient Care Services as a full member of the Nurse Executive Team. Participates in the strategic and long-range planning of Patient Care Services for Women’s and Children Services Participates in the determination of clinical and administrative nursing goals and directions. Provides leadership in critical thinking, conflict management and problem solving. Provides leadership in the development of leaders in collaboration with the human resource team to lead and manage through concerns and issues affecting associates and Women’s and Children services. Ensures education of associates and compliance with quality indicators and core measures Evaluates the quality and appropriateness of care.


Customer Cost

 Acquires and allocates human, material and financial resources for specific functions and processes. Ensures compliance with Budget expectations and corporate financial goals. Participates in ongoing evaluation and innovation of services provided by organized nursing services and the organization as a whole. The System Director is accountable for practicing fiscal responsibility by developing and assisting in the development of realistic annual operating and capital budgets, conserving resources, and monitoring expenditures to ensure they remain within budgeted parameters. Collaborates with the VP of Nursing to assume responsibility for the preparation of strategic goals, objectives and operating plans for assigned areas at the beginning of the fiscal year. Collaborates with Providers/Senior Leadership/Directors/Managers to ensure personnel management in an efficient and cost effective manner; and manages staffing costs effectively and efficiently. Leads the preparation and management of operating, personnel and capital budgets in a fiscally responsible manner. Coordinates resources with an understanding of patient care needs, projected patient census and changes in healthcare technology. Reviews operating budget monthly and reports abnormal findings to the VP of Nursing.


Delight

 Serves as a professional role model and mentor to motivate, develop, recruit and retain future nursing leaders. Serves as a change agent, assisting all staff in understanding the importance, necessity, impact and process of change Accepts organizational accountability for services provided to recipients. Fosters a climate conducive to educational experiences for nursing and other students Facilitates communication to meet the ongoing demands of the organization Contributes to the patient experience as evidenced by positive patient satisfaction scores and HCAHPs scores for department/medical center and/or written compliments by patients/others as well as consistent performance of purposeful hourly rounding an bedside shift report.


Access

 Provides leadership to reduce friction to our customers on accessing care. Serves as a consultant to the strategy team on ways to improve access and services Participates in communications with the marketing team on best practices to enhance wellness, community outreach for service line, and education to the community. Participates in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team on ease of accessing care, education, information, and initiatives improving the care of the service line.


Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

 Master’s degree in Nursing, Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, or related required. Knowledge of TJC and applicable regulatory agencies. Must hold and maintain current AHA BLS Healthcare Provider Completion card on hire / employment. Current Florida RN license. Minimum of 3-5 years clinical obstetrical experience. Minimum of 5 years in nursing leadership. Demonstrated leadership skills. Basic computer skills utilizing the Windows environment. Maintains professional competencies by attending continuing education programs and participation in professional organizations. Highly developed communication skills, verbal and non-verbal. Sound organizational skills to include time management and problem solving. Must be able to speak/understand written and verbal instructions in the English language.


Physical Demands

 Corrected vision and hearing to normal range. Good physical condition Potential for exposure to bio hazardous waste, and known or unknown diseases.


Mental Demands

 Ability to display and promote the I-Care values. Ability to listen well and analyze needs from various ages and levels of education. Ability to access/interpret data and educate. Problem solving skills utilizing the Continuous Quality Improvement process. Ability to work in a stressful environment. Ability to respond to life threatening situations. Ability to effectively manage multiple priority activities.


Job

Clinical Professional

Organization

Holmes Regional Medical Center

Primary Location :

United States- Florida - Brevard County- Melbourne

Schedule

Full-time

Shift Times

7:30 am - 4:00 pm

Job Level

Director

title: Damage Field Investigator
description:
Description

Project Resources Group (PRG) is a rapidly growing company with Corporate Headquarters in Greenwood Village, CO, and operations in over 40 states around the country. With over two decades of experience, we have become a leader committed to supporting our customers to reach their business goals in the telecommunication, gas, and utility industries.

We are looking for an outside plant expert for our Damage Field Investigator role in the area. Is that you? This may be the perfect fit if you are self-motivated, organized, and comfortable with an On-Call schedule.

On a typical day, you will be responsible for the following tasks

On-site investigation of underground and aerial cable plant damagesLearning, understanding, and being able to utilize State Dig Laws and Statutes, excavator requirements, NESC standardsDevelop a professional working relationship with the client, their contractors, technicians, management team, and other personnelDevelop a solid working relationship with the client’s locate company and exchange investigation informationConduct interviews on damage sites with contractors, technicians, witnesses, police, homeowners, etc.Professionally photograph and process the damaged scene to accurately portray and determine liability.Work with the client and contractors to obtain and write up job repair costs from the damage.Compile all investigation material and email it to the local handling office.Assist Claims Recovery team post-investigationDevelop and maintain monthly market reporting and lead meetings with clients to reviewBe available at all times as necessary to field damage calls and respond across the market.Maintain a working knowledge of the entire PRG claims process


You should possess the following skills and abilities to be successful in this role

Reliable and presentable personal vehicle with valid driver’s license and current insurance; min BI/PD 100/300/100Must possess strong customer service skills in written and verbal communicationsProficient in MS Word, Outlook, and Excel, as well as an ability to navigate a variety of operational tasks on a computerInvestigation experienceKnowledge of the cable industry and/or utility locate industryMove to the front of the line if you have telephone industry experience, including equipment and job costingFlexible work scheduleLaw enforcement and/or prior investigator a plusClaims background also plus


PRG Offers The Following Perks And Compensation

$48K-$52K/yr Mileage reimbursement for vehicle useHealth benefits include medical, dental & vision for you and your dependents on the first of the month following your start date.Company-paid Short-term Disability benefits after one year of service.401(k) Plan on the first of the month following your start date with a safe-harbor match after one year of service.Supplemental Life Insurance is offered for you and your dependents.ClassPass shared cost membership is offered to each employee.Paid time off, holiday pay, and a floating holiday so you can enjoy time with your friends and family.
