title: Financial Analyst - Multi-Group Physician Practice
description:
Job Title: Financial Analyst - Multi-Group Physician Practice
Location: Remote(This opportunity is a remote position however, to ensure effective collaboration and coordination with our team, the role requires availability during Eastern Time Zone business hours).
Company Overview:
Personic Health is a leading advanced mobile wound care multi-group physician practice dedicated to delivering high-quality healthcare services to our communities. With a commitment to excellence and innovation, we strive to provide comprehensive care while continuously improving patient outcomes.
Position Overview:We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Financial Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial management within a multi-group physician practice setting. They will be responsible for overseeing financial operations, reporting, budgeting, strategic planning, and accounting duties to support our organization's growth and success.
Key Responsibilities:Help streamline and drive financial reporting processes, including the preparation of financial statements, P&L analysis, and variance reporting.Oversee inventory management and control procedures to optimize efficiency and minimize costs.Develop and maintain robust business and financial models to support decision-making and strategic planning initiatives.Lead the development of comprehensive financial plans and forecasts to guide organizational growth and expansion.Ensure compliance with taxation requirements and regulations, including oversight of tax planning and reporting activities.Proficiency with accounting software such as QuickBooks and Sage, ensuring accurate and timely financial data management.Prior experience with Sage requiredAssist with accounts payable and accounts receivable processes, including reconciling accounts and ensuring timely payments and collections.Implement internal controls and procedures to safeguard financial assets and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.Oversee payroll processes, ensuring accurate compensation for healthcare staff.Track and analyze expenses to support budgeting and cost analysis initiatives.Support with revenue cycle management, including billing, collections, and reimbursement processes.Stay informed about changes and updates in accounting standards and regulations relevant to healthcare finance.Collaborate with other departments, such as HR and operations, to ensure accurate financial data and reporting.Implement cost accounting methodologies to analyze and allocate expenses across departments or service lines.Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in accounting operations.Support with financial audits and facilitate the audit process.Maintain fixed assets and depreciation schedules within the organization.Lead financial forecasting and budgeting processes, including variance analysis and budget performance tracking.Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to healthcare accounting, such as HIPAA and Medicare billing guidelines.Foster a culture of excellence and high performance within the finance team.
Qualifications:Master’s degree in finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or CPA preferred.Proven experience in financial analysis within a multi-group physician practice setting, with 5-7 years of relevant experience.Strong understanding of financial reporting, analysis, budgeting, and accounting principles.Extensive knowledge of taxation aspects related to entities within the healthcare industry.Technical proficiency with accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage) and Microsoft Excel.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment.Strong work ethic, high energy, and a commitment to excellence.Sage experience is required
Join our team and make a difference! If you meet the qualifications outlined above and are passionate about financial analysis within the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this position. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Trade Show Coordinator
description:
Are you the talented Trade Show Coordinator Flexco is seeking? We are looking for a highly motivated, self-starter to manage the planning, coordination, and execution of our trade shows and other events. This person must have the ability to work both collaboratively and independently in order to efficiently manage and execute multiple shows in varying industries. We are not just looking for someone who will check things off a list; we are looking for someone who will fully engage with our sales and marketing team members with the intent to help generate not only a buzz, but also new customer leads. This person will be part of a highly-efficient and collaborative team. 
Purpose: Perform duties to coordinate trade show and promotional program activities and provide a variety of support services for digital communications and marketing department activities.
Education Requirements:Associates Degree in related field required; Bachelors preferred.
Experience Requirements:Minimum of 3 years of experience in trade show planning and execution. 
Competency Requirements:Excellent planning, scheduling, and organizational skills required.Proficiency with SharePoint preferred and Microsoft Office required.Excellent written and oral communication, as well as listening skills required.Ability to work effectively under pressure, adhere to deadlines, deliver high-quality results, and manage multiple priorities.Continually obtains basic knowledge of Flexco products and applies knowledge to job requests
Responsibilities: Lead in the documentation and coordination of a yearly global trade show plan.Coordinate North American trade show activities such as: securing booth space, services, and materials at the show - including sample and literature requests, artwork needs, hotel accommodations, lead retrieval and booth layout.Liaison with global subsidiary locations as needed to support international shows.Coordinate display materials and maintain SharePoint display library; coordinating offsite storage and shipments with multiple Flexco locations and Exhibit House.Work with internal and external vendors to maintain and upgrade display materials as needed.Attend trade shows as needed. Assist with setup and teardown, greet visitors, and follow up on requests. Visit competitor booths to generate ideas and share them with the team.Monitor and maintain inventory levels of promotional items and follow up on reordering additional items as needed. Research and recommend additions to program as directed.Coordinate major marketing events as assigned.
Travel Requirements: Up to 20% domestic travel 
Flexco is an equal-opportunity employer offering a generous compensation and benefits package including:Fully funded Pension planMedical (including Rx), dental, vision on day ONE of employment 401(k) with matching funds12 paid holidays per yearUp to 15 vacation days and 5 personal daysTuition reimbursement/educational assistancePension plan, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and more.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Senior Accountant
description:

You will also install or advise on systems of recording costs or other financial and budgetary data.
Job Duties & ResponsibilitiesExamine, analyze, and interpret accounting records, documents, and reports to ensure accuracy and compliance with established accounting standards and principles.Perform month close activities under USGAAP and IFRS.Perform timely balance sheet reconciliationsResponsible for maintaining and documenting of internal controls to comply with Sarbanes-Oxley in the assigned areas.Prepare accurate and timely financial reports, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.Collaborate with colleagues to develop and maintain effective financial and budgetary data recording systems.Provide advice and recommendations to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of accounting processes and procedures.Conduct internal and external audits to ensure that financial records are accurate and in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.Assist in the development and implementation of financial policies and procedures to promote accurate and timely financial reporting.Complete additional tasks or responsibilities as assigned.
Work ExperienceRequires in depth knowledge and experienceUses best practice and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or servicesSolves complex problems.Has strong analytic abilities.Excellent attention to details.Takes a new perspective using existing solutionsWorks independently, receives minimal guidanceHas 5 to 7 years of work experienceAdvanced Microsoft office skills required.Experience with major ERP systems - SAP preferred.
EducationAssociate's Degree, Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in a related field is preferred.Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
CertificationsCertifications may be required or preferred.
